title: Psychonauts anyone?
content:
Anyone play this gem yet? Its Tim Schafer's latest game (day of the tentacle, Monkey Island, Grim Fandango) and so far its pretty fun. The gameplay is basicly a full platformer ala Mario 64 mixed in with some point and click adventure game elements. The humor and characters are great so far too. I just bought it for my pc and even though I'm only a few hours in I can tell I'm in for a ride.Check out my blog at [url=http://spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/]spaces.msn.com/members/superadammario/[/url]
Check out my fanfics at [url=http://www.fanfiction.net/u/680124/]fanfiction.net[/url]

title: hehe
content: A friend of mine really liked this game, but it wasn't able to load past a certain level due to hardware conflicts.  I've been thinking of trying out the XBox version... it seems very awesome.

title: Re: Psychonauts anyone?
content:
This is the official site: [url=http://www.psychonauts.com/]www.psychonauts.com/[/url]
I know the name, don't know the game.
(Argh! That rhymed!)

Great, the website does one of those things a website should never do.
You can't even see where you're going until you move your mouse over something.
I don't understand that kind of reasoning by website authors...
Anyway, on the find my way, I'm not that easily discouraged.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re:
content: I wanna check out this game some time. I heard it was really good, despite bad advertising. Sort of a shame, the adventure game is sort of a dying genre. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: Re:
content:
It's more a 3D platformer than an adventure game.

I played through the demo and I liked it a lot. I was especially pleased that it worked properly with my gamepad (dual analog sticks). I definitely recommend using one to play it. I think I'll get the full version soon.________________
